quotes.message: Be sincere; be brief; be seated.
quotes.name: Franklin D Roosevelt

quotes.message: Whatever advice you give, be brief.
quotes.name: Horace

quotes.message: A short saying often contains much wisdom.
quotes.name: Sophocles

quotes.message: If I am to speak ten minutes, I need a week for preparation; if fifteen minutes, three days; if half an hour, two days; if an hour, I am ready now.
quotes.name: Woodrow Wilson

quotes.message: It is my ambition to say in ten sentences what other men say in whole books - what other men do not say in whole books.
quotes.name: Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche

quotes.message: The most valuable of all talents is that of never using two words when one will do.
quotes.name: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.message: The present letter is a very long one, simply because I had no leisure to make it shorter.
quotes.name: Blaise Pascal

quotes.message: Brevity is the soul of lingerie.
quotes.name: Dorothy Parker

quotes.message: Let thy speech be short, comprehending much in few words.
quotes.name: The Bible

quotes.message: There's a great power in words, if you don't hitch too many of them together.
quotes.name: Josh Billings

quotes.message: The fewer the words, the better the prayer.
quotes.name: Martin Luther

quotes.message: Brevity is a great charm of eloquence.
quotes.name: Cicero
